page.title: 08COLWYN BAY BEACH
page.content: Colwyn Bay beach has large stretches of sand.It also has rocks and rock pools,and old wooden groynes going all along the beach. It is important that the beach is kept clean and free from pollution especially as Colwyn Bay is a holiday resort. The beach is usually free from litter but we have found broken glass,drinks cans,steel wire and rusty iron in places.The sewage from the town goes into the sea.The disposal pipe is near Rhos Point.It is six hundred metres long.The sewage is released into the sea at high tide and flows North West, away from the beach into the Irish Sea.In the early summer we sometimes get an algal bloom on the sea and the beach.This comes from millions of tiny algae.When they die and decompose they cause lots of brown and white froth to form and this creates a pungent smell.
